com.password4j

Interface HashingFunction

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractHashingFunction, BCryptFunction, CompressedPBKDF2Function, PBKDF2Function, SCryptFunction

    public interface HashingFunction
    This interface declares the basic methods that all the Cryptographic Hashing Functions (CHF) must have.

    The two possible operations are

    • hashing a plaintext password
    • check if an hash is originated by a plaintext password

    The purpose of this interface is encapsulate the logic of hashing and checking of a CHF inside a class.

    Since:
    0.1.0
    Author:
    David Bertoldi

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean check(CharSequence plainTexPassword, String hashed)
      Checks if the CHF generated the hash starting from the plaintext password.
      boolean check(CharSequence plainTextPassword, String hashed, String salt)
      Checks if the CHF generated the hash starting from the plaintext password and the salt.
      Hash hash(CharSequence plainTextPassword)
      Creates a Hash from a plaintext password.
      Hash hash(CharSequence plainTextPassword, String salt)
      Creates a Hash from a plaintext password and a salt.

    • Method Detail

      • hash

        Hash hash(CharSequence plainTextPassword)
        Creates a Hash from a plaintext password. Depending on the implementation, the hash may contain the information about salt and pepper.

        The salt is always generated randomly.

        The generation of the salt is completely responsibility of the implementing class.

        Parameters:
        plainTextPassword - the password to be hashed
        Returns:
        a Hash
        Since:
        0.1.0
        See Also:
        hash(CharSequence, String)

      • hash

        Hash hash(CharSequence plainTextPassword,
          String salt)
        Creates a Hash from a plaintext password and a salt. Depending on the implementation, the hash may contain the information about salt and pepper.

        Some CHFs validate the format of the salt; if the validation is not passed a BadParametersException is thrown. The generation of the salt is completely responsibility of the caller.

        Parameters:
        plainTextPassword - the password to be hashed
        salt - the salt used in the hashing process
        Returns:
        a Hash
        Throws:
        BadParametersException - if the salt does not pass the validation of the CHF
        Since:
        0.1.0

      • check

        boolean check(CharSequence plainTexPassword,
              String hashed)
        Checks if the CHF generated the hash starting from the plaintext password.

        This method must be used when the salt is part of the hash. If the CHF expects a salt separated from the hash, an UnsupportedOperationException is thrown.

        In case the CHF expects a salt to be part of the hash, if the format of the hash is not valid (e.g. the CHF cannot recognise a valid salt) a BadParametersException is thrown.

        Parameters:
        plainTexPassword - the plaintext password
        hashed - the hash
        Returns:
        true if the hash is generated from the plaintext; false otherwise
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - if the CHF need a salt and it is not part of the hash
        BadParametersException - if the hash is not well-formed
        Since:
        0.1.0

      • check

        boolean check(CharSequence plainTextPassword,
              String hashed,
              String salt)
        Checks if the CHF generated the hash starting from the plaintext password and the salt.

        This method must be used when the salt is not part of the hash.

        If the format of the hash is not valid (e.g. the CHF cannot recognise a valid salt) a BadParametersException is thrown.

        Parameters:
        plainTextPassword - the plaintext password
        hashed - the hash
        salt - the salt used to produce the hash
        Returns:
        true if the hash is generated from the plaintext; false otherwise
        Throws:
        BadParametersException - if the hash is not well-formed
        Since:
        0.2.1
